review: "Dragon Knights, Volume 5" offers a mix of adventure and character-driven moments, which align with my interest in dynamic and engaging storytelling. The interactions between Thatz and Kitchel, along with the introduction of the adorable fairy Ringley, add a charming and entertaining element to the narrative. However, the pacing is a bit uneven, with some parts feeling drawn out, particularly the subplot involving Tupet. The attempt to revert Cesia to her true form also felt less engaging and somewhat predictable. While the book has its strengths, these issues prevent it from being a standout volume in the series."
